inlineContent.text: An attributed string to style and display,
Use this initializer to style text according to attributes found in the specified

view modifiers. For example, the attributed text in the following
example appears in blue, despite the use of the
modifier to use red throughout the enclosing

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A view that displays an image.
An action that opens a URL.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
Creates a text view that displays styled attributed content.
Creates a text view that displays a localized string resource.
Creates an instance that displays a localized range between two dates.
Creates an instance that displays a localized time interval.
Creates an instance that wraps an
, suitable for concatenating
with other
Creates a text view that displays a stored string without localization.
Creates a text view that displays localized content identified by a key.
A view that arranges its subviews in a vertical line.
Sets the color of the foreground elements displayed by this view.
A value type for a string with associated attributes for portions of its text.
A property for accessing the attribute scopes that SwiftUI defines.
Attribute scopes that AppKit defines.
Attribute scopes that Foundation defines.
A property for accessing the link attribute.
A property for accessing an inline presentation intent attribute.
Attribute scopes that SwiftUI defines.
Attribute scopes that UIKit defines.
A type that defines presentation intent for runs of characters for traits like emphasis, strikethrough, and code voice.
An intent that represents a strongly emphasized presentation.
An intent that represents a line break.
An intent that represents a soft line break.
The span of time between a specific start date and end date.
A value type for a string with associated attributes for portions of its text.
A reference to a localizable string, accessible from another process.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
An interval from a lower bound up to, and including, an upper bound.
A type that can represent a string as a collection of characters.
